alert.note: Alert for Brown; Greene; Jackson; Lawrence; Monroe (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 17 at 11:47PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Indiana and southwest Indiana, including the following counties, in south central Indiana, Brown, Jackson, Lawrence and Monroe. In southwest Indiana, Greene. * WHEN...Until 245 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1147 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bloomington, Seymour, Brownstown, Charles Deam Wilderness, Norman, Elkinsville, Heltonville, Kurtz, Story, Bartlettsville, Monroe Reservoir, Woodville Hills, Spurgeons Corner, Freetown, Fairfax State Recreation Area, Smithville, Harrodsburg and Cortland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
